qas.question: Humoral immunology involves the interaction of what two elements?
The term "antigen" is rooted in what two words?
Immunology is the study of what type of responses to antibodies and antigens?

context: The humoral (antibody) response is defined as the interaction between <a0_0>antibodies and antigens<a0_0/>. Antibodies are <a1_0>specific proteins<a1_0/> released from a certain class of immune cells known as <a2_0>B lymphocytes<a2_0/>, while antigens are defined as anything that elicits the generation of antibodies (<a3_0>"anti"body "gen"erators<a3_0/>). Immunology rests on an understanding of the properties of these two biological entities and the <a4_0>cellular response<a4_0/> to both.
